alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 09 at 5:34AM AKST until February 10 at 5:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 5 PM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Reduced visibilities to one-half mile. * WHERE...Bristol Bay, from Dillingham and west. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 5 PM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will begin early Friday morning and continue through Saturday morning. Northeasterly winds are expected to increase through Friday morning, bringing the potential for significant visibility reductions in blowing snow. Visibility should improve by Friday afternoon as winds diminish.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
